en: The story appears to illustrate a story like the Bhallāṭiya Jātaka in the Pāḷi collection (Ja 504). King Bhallāṭiya, the Bodhisattva in a previous life, one time went out on a hunt with his men and dogs and spent a long time on the hunt. Hearing the pitiful wailing of two kinnaras he bid his dogs hide themselves away, and approached very quietly.

He asked them why they were crying and they explained that one time they had been separated from each other for a night, and they still grieved for that unfortunate event, which had happened nearly 600 years previously. The king learned his lesson and returned to Benares where he was henceforth content to dwell.

I am not entirely convinced that this is the story illustrated as nothing about them suggests the kinnaras are weeping—surely the crucial point of the story—and in fact they look quite content. There was quiet possibly another story involving two kinnaras which we do not know now.
id: Cerita ini muncul untuk menggambarkan cerita Bhallāṭiya Jātaka dalam kumpulan Pāḷi (Ja 504). Raja Bhallāṭiya, Bodhisattwa dalam kehidupan lampau, suatu hari pergi berburu dengan orang-orangnya dan anjinganjingnya, dan menghabiskan waktu lama dalam perburuan. Mendengar ratapan pilu dua kinnara, raja mendiamkan dan menyembunyikan anjinganjingnya, dan mendekat dengan sangat senyap.

Ia bertanya kepada mereka mengapa mereka menangis dan mereka menjelaskan bahwa suatu kali mereka berpisah satu sama lain selama semalam, dan mereka masih berduka atas peristiwa malang itu, yang terjadi hampir 600 tahun yang lalu. Raja mendapat pelajarannya dan kembali ke Benares, di mana ia selanjutnya tinggal dengan merasa cukup.

Saya tidak sepenuhnya yakin bahwa ini cerita yang digambarkan, karena tidak ada satu pun relief yang menunjukkan para kinnara yang menangis— yang pasti hal terpenting dalam cerita—dan pada kenyataannya mereka terlihat cukup puas. Mungkin ada cerita lain yang melibatkan dua kinnara yang saat ini tidak kita ketahui.

en: The scene is set in the wilderness which the trees, the stylised rocks and the flowing river all show. On the right we see the king who is standing, and a couple of his men who sit to the side. The figures are unfortunately damaged.

On the left are pictured the pair of kinnaras. Interestingly, although they are described as human-like in the Jātaka, and their brethren were portrayed as human-like in Sudhana’s story at the beginning of this wall, the kinnaras here are definitely half bird and half human.
id: Adegan terletak di belantara, yang mana pepohonan, bebatuan kasar, dan sungai mengalir, semua ditampilkan. Di kanan, kita lihat raja berdiri, dan sepasang anak buahnya duduk di sampingnya. Sosok-sosok itu sayangnya rusak.

Di kiri terlihat sepasang kinnara. Menariknya, walau mereka digambarkan seperti manusia di Jātaka, dan kerabat mereka digambarkan serupa manusia dalam cerita Sudhana di awal dinding ini, para kinnara di sini jelas setengah burung setengah manusia.

en: In the centre sits the king, this time he has his hands held in añjali, worshipping the semi-divine beings in front of him. Behind him are some of his men, and curiously small portraits of elephants and crocodiles.
On the left the kinnaras stand and the male has his hand held out in front of him as though admonishing the king. Notice the birds in the trees who seem to fly in to witness the scene.
id: Di tengah, duduk raja, kali ini ia menangkupkan tangan, menyembah makhluk setengah-surgawi di depannya. Di belakangnya ada beberapa anak buahnya, dan pahatan kecil gajah dan buaya yang aneh.
Di kiri, berdiri dua kinnara dan yang lelaki menjulurkan tangannya ke depan seolah menegur raja. Perhatikan burung di pohon yang terlihat terbang menyaksikan adegan.

en: Krom assigns this panel to the Bhallāṭiya story, but it seems highly unlikely it is connected, as it is separated by a stairwell from the previous panels, and seems to feature the same characters as on the next panel.

On the right we see a building, and in front of it is a pavilion on which sits a king with his consorts. Many servants seem to be quite squashed under his seat. In front of him is a female attendant with a fly whisk, and then a male figure who sits with his companions and worships the king. Behind the seated figures we see an elephant and horses, so we may take it the visitors are royalty.
id: Krom menetapkan panel ini sebagai cerita Bhallāṭiya, namun sepertinya sangat tidak mungkin berkaitan, karena panel dipisahkan oleh tangga dari panel sebelumnya, dan tampak menampilkan sosok-sosok yang sama seperti pada panel berikutnya.

Di kanan, kita lihat bangunan, dan di depannya ada anjungan yang di dalamnya duduk raja dengan para selirnya. Banyak pelayan tampak cukup tergencet di bawah kursinya. Di depannya ada pelayan wanita dengan kebutan, kemudian sosok lelaki yang duduk dengan teman-temannya memuja raja. Di belakang sosok yang duduk, kita lihat gajah dan kuda, jadi kita dapat menganggap para pengunjung adalah bangsawan.

en: We have another of these scenes which are seen so frequently on the walls at Borobudur: a king or other member of the royalty arrives for a meeting with a king. Without a specific story to attach it too, of course, it just becomes a generic scene.

The king sits with two of his consorts on the right of the panel inside a simple pavilion. In front of him, and at the same height, is his royal visitor sitting under a tree. Behind him is his entourage including a finely drawn elephant with its full regalia.
id: Kita punya beberapa adegan lain yang sering terlihat di dinding Borobudur: raja atau anggota keluarga kerajaan lain datang untuk bertemu dengan raja. Tanpa cerita khusus untuk menjelaskannya, tentu saja, itu hanya jadi adegan umum.

Raja duduk dengan dua pendampingnya di kanan panel, dalam anjungan sederhana. Di depannya, di ketinggian yang sama, ada pengunjung kerajaannya yang duduk di bawah pohon. Di belakangnya ada rombongannya, termasuk gajah yang dipahat halus dengan tanda kebesaran lengkap.

en: The scene in set in the wilderness with trees and many birds atop them. A king sits on a small horse in the centre of the relief, behind him an attendant holds a parasol over him, and behind him are more attendants and soldiers who hold arrows.

In front of the king is someone who appears to be pointing to the wild animals seen on the left of the relief. Presumably he is a guide. The animals include a couple of pigs, a deer and a pair of squirrels playing in the trees. In the top left corner we also see a monkey.
id: Adegan ditata di belantara dengan pepohonan dan banyak burung di atas. Raja duduk di atas kuda kecil di tengah relief, di belakangnya pelayan memegangi payung di atasnya, dan di belakang ada lebih banyak pelayan dan prajurit yang memegang panah.

Di depan raja ada seseorang yang tampak menunjuk hewan liar yang terlihat di kiri relief. Kemungkinan ia pemandu. Hewan-hewan itu termasuk sepasang babi, rusa, dan sepasang tupai yang bermain di pepohonan. Di sudut kiri atas kita juga lihat monyet.

en: On the right we see a very well drawn pavilion which is elaborately decorated. On a raised seat inside the king sits with his knee supported by a strap. He is looking back at his queen who sits behind him. At a lower level, and behind the queen, two attendants are pictured.

On the left a group of people sit on the floor, a number of whom hold their hands in añjali. They all have the same type of headband which probably signifies they are from a foreign kingdom. Above them are the regalia: a leaffan, a peacock-feather fan and a parasol.
id: Di kanan, kita lihat anjungan yang dipahat dengan sangat bagus dengan hiasan rumit. Di kursi tinggi di dalam, raja duduk dengan lutut ditopang bebat. Ia menengok ratu yang duduk di belakangnya. Di lantai yang lebih rendah, di belakang ratu, dua pelayan digambarkan.

Di kiri sekelompok orang duduk di lantai, beberapa di antaranya menangkupkan tangan. Mereka semua punya jenis ikat kepala sama yang mungkin menandakan mereka berasal dari kerajaan asing. Di atas mereka ada tanda kebesaran: kipas daun, kipas bulu merak, dan payung.

en: The whole scene is set outside under the trees and in rocky terrain. On the right are three men, two of whom hold weapons, and the third is leaning forward and pointing with his hand above his head. The role these three play is hard to know.

In the centre and on the left children are being saved from drowning, and being passed to people who carry them away on their hips, and towards the man who is pointing. On the far left is one boy who stands with his hand on his hip. He must be in the water also, but does not appear to be distressed like the others.
id: Seluruh adegan ditempatkan di luar di bawah pohon dan di lahan berbatu. Di kanan ada tiga lelaki, dua diantaranya pegang senjata, dan yang ketiga condong ke depan dan menunjuk dengan tangan di atas kepalanya. Peran yang dimainkan ketiganya sulit diketahui.

Di tengah dan di kiri, anak-anak diselamatkan dari tenggelam, dan diserahkan kepada orang-orang yang menggendong mereka di pinggul mereka, dan ke arah orang yang menunjuk. Di kiri jauh ada anak lelaki yang berdiri dengan tangan di pinggulnya. Ia seharusnya berada dalam air juga, tetapi tidak tampak tertekan seperti yang lain.

en: So many times on these reliefs we have a generic scene which I have designated ‘A Meeting with a King’ as we simply do not know what is taking place without a text to identify it. Here we have a variation, which is a meeting with a queen.

On the right the queen sits inside a very elaborate building and is making a gesture with her hand to the interlocutor who sits in a heavily decorated antechamber in front of her. Outside in a pavilion sit eleven members of his entourage. Notice the birds above both buildings.
id: Banyak kali pada relief-relief ini, kita mendapati adegan umum yang telah saya tetapkan sebagai “Pertemuan Dengan Raja” karena kita tidak tahu apa yang terjadi tanpa naskah untuk mengenalinya. Di sini kita punya ragam lain, yaitu pertemuan dengan ratu.

Di kanan, ratu duduk dalam bangunan yang sangat rumit dan membuat isyarat dengan tangannya mengulur ke teman bicara yang duduk di selasar yang sangat dihias di hadapannya. Di luar, dalam anjungan, duduk sebelas anggota rombongannya. Perhatikan burung di atas kedua bangunan.

en: This scene is set in the wilderness, with trees, a lake and birds populating it. In the middle sits a nāga who has apparently emerged from the waters where he lives.
On the right side we see a king in conversation with the nāga. The king and the nāga appear to be positioned at the same height. The king’s soldiers are behind him, holding swords of various kinds.
id: Adegan ini terletak di belantara, dengan pepohonan, danau, dan burung yang menghuninya. Di tengah, duduk naga yang tampak muncul dari air di mana ia tinggal.
Di sisi kanan kita lihat raja bicara dengan naga. Raja dan naga tampak ditempatkan di sama tinggi. Para prajurit raja ada di belakangnya, memegang berbagai jenis pedang.

en: This panel appears to be split into two, separated by the tree trunk in the middle. On the right, which would be seen first, and will therefore come earlier in the story, we see a brahmin sitting with some friends inside a simple building. Towards the centre sit the womenfolk.

On the left it appears the same character is now at the head of a delegation to the king, who sits inside a pavilion on a raised seat with his two consorts. There is a very well-drawn coconut tree above his companions, and birds are dotted about.
id: Panel ini tampak dibagi dua, dipisahkan dengan batang pohon di tengah. Di kanan, yang akan dilihat terlebih dahulu, dan karena itu akan muncul lebih awal dalam cerita, kita lihat brahmana duduk dengan beberapa teman dalam bangunan sederhana. Ke arah tengah, duduk kaum perempuan.

Di kiri, tampak sosok yang sama sekarang jadi kepala perwakilan untuk raja, yang duduk dalam anjungan di kursi tinggi dengan dua pendampingnya. Ada pohon kelapa yang dipahat sangat bagus di atas rombongan, dan burung bertebaran.

name.en: 99. A King flies in the Sky

en: Again the scene is in two parts. On the right it seems the advisors and soldiers of the king have accompanied the king to the edge of the wilderness where he stands with his hand held up making a gesture.

On the left what must be the same king and one of his advisors are flying away on a cloud beyond the trees that separate the scenes. Birds are seen in the treetops below them. Reliefs like this make one really want to know the story, which alas! we lack.
id: Lagi-lagi adegan dalam dua bagian. Di kanan tampak para penasihat dan prajurit raja menemani raja ke tepi belantara, tempat ia berdiri dengan tangan diangkat membuat isyarat.

Di kiri, pasti raja yang sama dan salah satu penasihatnya terbang di atas awan di atas pepohonan yang memisahkan adegan. Burung terlihat di puncak pohon di bawah mereka. Relief seperti ini membuat orang sungguh ingin tahu ceritanya, yang sayang, kita kurang tahu.

en: On the far right we see a very fine palatial building, with stairs in front of it, and clouds and a bird above it. The king, who is presumably the owner also, sits in front of his courtiers and is gesturing as he speaks.
On the left a brahmin sits on a seat at the same height as the king, and his courtiers behind him are holding regalia signifying that he is also a king. On the far left is a finely drawn elephant.
id: Di kanan jauh, kita lihat bangunan megah yang sangat indah, dengan tangga di depannya, awan dan burung di atasnya. Raja, yang mungkin juga pemiliknya, duduk di depan pegawainya dan memberi isyarat saat ia bicara.

Di kiri, brahmana duduk di kursi yang sama tinggi dengan raja, dan para pegawai kerajaan di belakangnya memegang tanda kebesaran yang menandakan bahwa ia juga raja. Di kiri jauh ada gajah yang dipahat bagus.

en: This is a rather unusual relief if I am reading it right, it is dominated by a meeting scene which takes place inside a small building in the middle of the panel. What is unusual is that the queen on the left seems to be situated higher than the king, who is worshipping her. In similar scenes where we can identify the characters the king is meeting with his mother, and it may be so here.
On the right are what looks like the king’s men, with swords held high, sitting under trees upon which birds perch. On the left appear to be the queen’s ladies-in-waiting also sitting under a tree.
id: Ini relief yang tidak biasa, jika saya membacanya dengan benar, yang didominasi oleh adegan pertemuan yang berlangsung dalam bangunan kecil di tengah panel. Yang tidak biasa, ratu di kiri tampak terletak lebih tinggi dari raja, yang menyembahnya. Dalam adegan serupa, di mana kita bisa mengenali sosok-sosoknya, raja menemui ibunya, mungkin begitu pula di sini.
Di kanan ada apa yang terlihat seperti prajurit raja, dengan pedang terangkat tinggi, duduk di bawah pohon tempat burung bertengger. Di kiri tampak para dayang ratu juga duduk di bawah pohon.

en: Another of the generic ‘meeting with a king’ scenes, this one differs slightly by being set in the wilderness. On the right is pictured a forest, with seemingly a queen sitting under a tree on the far right. Nearer the centre sit two people who have particularly sublime expressions on their faces.

The king, whose figure is quite worn, sits at ease inside a simple pavilion and may have been speaking. In front of him two people sit on the floor with their hands raised in salutation, and behind them three more stand with bows strung over their shoulders.
id: Lain dari adegan umum “pertemuan dengan raja”, yang satu ini sedikit berbeda karena bertempat di belantara. Di kanan digambarkan hutan, dengan ratu yang tampak duduk di bawah pohon di kanan jauh. Dekat ke tengah, duduk dua orang yang punya pancaran sungguh luhur di paras mereka.

Raja, yang sosoknya cukup rusak, duduk santai dalam anjungan sederhana dan mungkin sedang bicara. Di depannya, dua orang duduk di lantai dengan tangan terangkat menghormat, dan di belakang mereka berdiri tiga lagi dengan busur digantung di bahu mereka.

en: On the right two kings sit at ease inside a simple pavilion and appear to be in discussion. On the far right one attendant is holding something up, but what it is is hard to say. Above him is a coconut tree.

On the left are the usual mixture of courtiers, soldiers and attendants that accompany one of the kings. There is an elephant behind them, and the normal regalia: a peacock-feather fan, and a leaf-fan, but no parasol this time.
id: Di kanan dua raja duduk santai dalam anjungan sederhana dan tampak sedang bertukar pikiran. Di kanan jauh, satu pelayan memegang sesuatu, tetapi sulit dibilang itu apa. Di atasnya ada pohon kelapa.

Di kiri ada gabungan seperti biasa pegawai, prajurit, dan pelayan yang menemani salah satu raja. Ada gajah di belakang mereka, dan tanda kebesaran seperti biasa: kipas bulu merak, kipas daun, tapi tak ada payung kali ini.

en: Similar to 101 above we here see a king pictured as lower than the queen he is meeting with, inside a simple and rather plain building. The queen is shown as being much larger than the king, and much higher also.
On the right are the king’s soldiers bearing arms, and many attendants carrying offerings and bearing regalia. On the left the womenfolk of the queen’s court look on.
id: Serupa dengan panel 101 di atas, di sini kita lihat raja digambarkan lebih rendah daripada ratu yang ia temui, dalam bangunan sederhana dan agak polos. Ratu ditampilkan jauh lebih besar dari raja, dan jauh lebih tinggi juga.
Di kanan ada prajurit raja yang membawa senjata, dan banyak pelayan membawa persembahan dan tanda kebesaran. Di kiri, kaum perempuan dari istana ratu memandang.

en: In the centre we see a very elaborately decorated building and a member of the nobility, probably a king, sitting in meditation posture. Behind his head is a halo signifying that this is a Bodhisattva.
On the right are the courtiers and attendants holding the royal insignia, and on the left we see others, including a brahmin who is sitting near to the building and may be the king’s advisor.
id: Di tengah, kita lihat bangunan yang dihias sangat rumit dan anggota bangsawan, mungkin raja, duduk dalam postur meditasi. Di belakang kepalanya ada aura yang menandakan bahwa ia Bodhisattwa.
Di kanan ada para pegawai dan pelayan memegang lambang kerajaan, dan di kiri kita lihat yang lainnya, termasuk brahmana yang duduk di dekat bangunan dan mungkin penasihat raja.

introductionSumary.en: The reliefs follow the Avadānaśataka (no 36) retelling of the story mainly. It is also known to the Divyāvadāna (no 38) and the Pāḷi Jātakas, but the latter has far less details and the main character is not the Bodhisattva, but a wicked man (Mittavinda, Ja 369).
introductionSumary.id: Relief mengikuti Avadānaśataka (no. 36) yang mengisahkan kembali sebagian besar cerita itu. Cerita juga diketahui dalam Divyāvadāna (no. 38) dan Jātaka Pāḷi, namun yang Jātaka Pāḷi punya rincian yang jauh lebih sedikit dan pemeran utamanya bukanlah Bodhisattwa, tetapi orang jahat (Mittavinda, Ja 369).

en: A merchant had a son, the Bodhisattva in a previous life, but his father gave him a girl’s name, Maitrakanyaka. Before the boy had grown the merchant died while on the high seas. When the boy grew up he wanted to follow in his father’s footsteps and asked his mother what his occupation had been.

His mother, not wanting to lose her son, lied and told him his father had been a shopkeeper, a perfumer and a goldsmith in succession. He was successful at all these trades, and so much so the other goldsmiths, who were jealous of him, told him his father had been a merchant who sailed the high seas just to get rid of the competition.

Maitrakanyaka then had it announced he would lead an expedition abroad, and 500 merchants joined him. His mother tried to dissuade him from going, but he kicked her in the head, and left on his adventure. His ship was soon shipwrecked though, and he was separated from the others.

Maitrakanyaka came to the city of Ramaṇaka and was greeted by four divine maidens (apsaras) who invited him to stay with them. He lived there many years, but was curious about what lay south, and set out to find out. Then he came to Sadāmatta, which had eight apsaras, and later Nandana which had sixteen.

Still traveling south he came next to Brahmottara, which had thirty-two divine maidens, but still not satisfied he traveled once more south and came to the city of Ayomaya (Iron-Made). As soon as he entered, the doors slammed shut behind him, and as he went deeper in, he was unable to escape.

Eventually he came into the presence of a tall man whose head was crowned with a wheel which was fiery and tearing his head apart. Asking what the man had done to deserve such a fate he was told he had ill-treated his own mother, at which Maitrakanyaka remembered he had kicked his mother in the head, and the wheel jumped from the tall man’s head to his own.

He asked how long he would have to suffer like this, and was told it would last 60,600 years before someone else who had committed the same sort of deed would take his place. Stirred by compassion Maitrakanyaka made an aspiration that the wheel would never leave his own head and hurt another in the same way. As soon as he made that aspiration the wheel flew away from his head and he was immediately reborn in Tuṣita Heaven.
id: Pedagang punya seorang putra, Bodhisattwa pada kehidupan lampau, tapi ayahnya memberinya nama perempuan, Maitrakanyaka. Sebelum anak itu dewasa, sang pedagang meninggal tatkala di laut lepas. Ketika anak itu tumbuh, ia ingin mengikuti jejak ayahnya dan bertanya kepada ibunya apa pekerjaan ayahnya.

Ibunya, tak ingin kehilangan putranya, berbohong dan berkata kepadanya bahwa ayahnya adalah penjaga toko, pembuat wewangian, dan pandai emas, berturutan. Ia berhasil dalam semua perdagangan ini, sehingga banyak pandai emas lainnya, yang iri padanya, memberi tahu bahwa ayahnya adalah pedagang yang mengarungi laut lepas, sekadar untuk menyingkirkan persaingan.

Maitrakanyaka lalu mengumumkan bahwa ia akan memimpin perjalanan ke negeri lain, dan 500 pedagang bergabung dengannya. Ibunya berusaha mencegahnya untuk pergi, tetapi ia malah menendang kepala ibunya, dan pergi bertualang. Namun, kapalnya tak lama karam, dan ia terpisah dari yang lain.

Maitrakanyaka tiba di Kota Ramaṇaka dan disambut empat bidadari surga (apsara) yang mengundangnya tinggal bersama mereka. Ia tinggal di sana bertahun-tahun, namun penasaran tentang apa yang ada di selatan, dan berangkat untuk mencari tahu. Lalu ia datang ke Sadāmatta, yang punya delapan apsara, lalu Nandana yang punya enam belas apsara.
Masih bepergian ke selatan, ia tiba di Brahmottara, yang punya tiga puluh dua bidadari surga, namun masih belum puas, ia melakukan perjalanan

sekali lagi ke selatan dan tiba di Kota Ayomaya (Terbuat dari Besi). Begitu ia masuk, pintu di belakangnya terbanting tertutup, dan saat ia masuk lebih dalam, ia tak bisa kabur. Akhirnya ia tiba di hadapan lelaki tinggi yang kepalanya dimahkotai roda api yang menyala dan mencabik kepalanya. Bertanya apa yang telah dilakukan lelaki itu sehingga bernasib demikian, Maitrakanyaka diberi tahu bahwa ia telah memperlakukan ibunya sendiri dengan buruk, yang membuat Maitrakanyaka teringat ia telah menendang kepala ibunya, dan roda itu melompat dari kepala lelaki tinggi itu ke kepalanya.

Ia bertanya berapa lama ia harus menderita seperti ini, dan diberi tahu bahwa itu akan berlangsung 60.600 tahun sebelum orang lain yang melakukan tindakan yang sama akan menggantikannya. Tergerak oleh welas asih, Maitrakanyaka membuat tekad bahwa roda itu tidak akan pernah meninggalkan kepalanya sendiri dan melukai orang lain dengan cara yang sama. Begitu ia membuat tekad itu, roda terbang menjauh dari kepalanya dan ia seketika terlahir ulang di Surga Tuṣita.

en: When Maitrakanyaka had grown up he asked his mother about his father’s occupation, and was first told he had been a shopkeeper, and later that he had been a perfumer. He took up the trades and at the end of the day offered the money he had made to his mother.

Maitrakanyaka sits inside a pavilion with his mother, who is positioned much higher then he is. He has a money bag in front of him which he is offering to her. On the far left is a building, perhaps meant to signify the city where he had been working.
id: Ketika Maitrakanyaka telah dewasa, ia bertanya kepada ibunya tentang pekerjaan ayahnya, dan pertama kali diberi tahu bahwa ayahnya adalah penjaga toko, lalu ia menjadi pembuat wewangian. Maitrakanyaka menjalani perdagangan itu dan pada akhir hari mempersembahkan uang yang ia hasilkan kepada ibunya.

Maitrakanyaka duduk dalam anjungan bersama ibunya, yang ditempatkan jauh lebih tinggi darinya. Ia punya kantong uang di depannya yang ia persembahkan kepada ibunya. Di kiri jauh ada bangunan, mungkin dimaksudkan untuk menandakan kota tempat ia bekerja.

name.id: 107. Bekerja Sebagai Pandai Emas dan Berangkat

en: Next Maitrakanyaka worked as a goldsmith, but was so good at the trade that other goldsmiths got jealous and informed him of his father’s true occupation. He therefore gave up that trade also and set forth to become a merchant on the high seas, but not before he kicked his mother in the head as she tried to prevent him.

The panel is in two sections. On the right we first see Maitrakanyaka plying his trade as a goldsmith, he sits on the far right and is engaged with his customers who sit in front of him. The building near the middle acts as a divider. On the left we see him departing with another man. In front of him his mother is down on her knees pleading with him not to go.
id: Selanjutnya Maitrakanyaka bekerja sebagai pandai emas, namun sangat pandai berdagang, sehingga pandai emas lain iri dan memberitahunya mengenai pekerjaan ayahnya yang sebenarnya. Ia karenanya berhenti perdagangan itu juga dan mantap untuk menjadi pedagang di laut lepas, tetapi setelah ia menendang kepala ibunya ketika berusaha mencegahnya.

Panel dibagi dua. Di kanan kita pertama lihat Maitrakanyaka menjalani perdagangannya sebagai pandai emas, ia duduk di kanan jauh dan terlibat dengan para pelanggan yang duduk di hadapannya. Bangunan di dekat tengah berperan sebagai penyekat. Di kiri kita lihat Maitrakanyaka pergi dengan orang lain. Di depannya, ibunya berlutut memohon agar ia tidak pergi.

name.en: 108. The Ship and the Four Apsaras

en: In the Avadānaśataka story after Maitrakanyaka sets sail the ship is upturned by a makara fish and clinging to a plank of wood he makes it to shore. None of this is portrayed on the relief, and the sculptors may have known a different version of the story at this point. He eventually came to the city of Ramaṇaka where he was greeted by four divine nymphs (apsaras).

Again the scene is divided into two. On the right we see the finely-drawn ship sailing the high seas with its masts and sails held high. In front of it another boat seems to be grappling with some problem. On the right Maitrakanyaka has landed and is greeted by four well-dressed apsaras who will entertain him for many years.
id: Dalam cerita Avadānaśataka, setelah Maitrakanyaka berlayar, kapal digulingkan oleh ikan makara, dan berpegangan di papan kayu ia berhasil ke pantai. Tak satu pun ini digambarkan pada relief, dan para perupa mungkin telah mengetahui ragam cerita yang berbeda pada titik ini. Maitrakanyaka akhirnya tiba di Kota Ramaṇaka, tempat ia disambut oleh empat bidadari surga (apsara).

Lagi-lagi adegan dibagi dua. Di kanan kita lihat kapal yang dipahat indah berlayar di laut lepas dengan tiang dan layar terangkat tinggi. Di depannya ada perahu lain yang tampaknya sedang bergulat dengan masalah. Di kanan, Maitrakanyaka mendarat dan disambut oleh empat apsara berbusana indah yang akan menghiburnya selama bertahun-tahun.

en: The apsaras at Ramaṇaka always tried to dissuade Maitrakanyaka from going south of the city, which made him want to go there even more. Eventually he decided to go and he came to another city, Sadāmatta, where he was greeted by eight divine maidens more lovely than the ones he had left behind.

Surprisingly, we see nothing of the city, and indeed the scene is set in the wilderness. It is hard to know whether this represents a variation in the telling of the story. Maitrakanyaka stands on the right and sitting before him are the eight apsaras. The landscape is dotted with birds and animals.
id: Para apsara di Ramaṇaka selalu berusaha untuk mencegah Maitrakanyaka agar tidak pergi ke selatan kota, yang malah membuatnya makin ingin pergi ke sana. Akhirnya Maitrakanyaka memutuskan untuk pergi dan ia tiba di kota lain, Sadāmatta, di mana ia disambut oleh delapan bidadari surga yang lebih menyenangkan daripada yang ia tinggalkan.

Anehnya, kita tidak melihat apa pun di kota ini, dan pasti adegan bertempat di belantara. Sulit untuk tahu apakah ini mewakili ragam lain dalam penuturan cerita. Maitrakanyaka berdiri di kanan dan duduk di hadapannya delapan bidadari. Pemandangan dipenuhi dengan burung dan binatang.

en: After enjoying himself at Sadāmatta for many years Maitrakanyaka once again headed south, and met with sixteen nymphs in the city of Nandana, where he again took up residence.

On the relief we see only eleven apsaras, though it would easily have been possible to fit in sixteen if the sculptors wished. It may represent another variation, or it may just be a whim of the designers. Four are seen standing and seven are sitting. Again the scene is set in the countryside, not in the city.
id: Setelah bersenang-senang di Sadāmatta selama bertahun-tahun, Maitrakanyaka sekali lagi menuju ke selatan, dan bertemu dengan enam belas bidadari di Kota Nandana, tempat ia kembali menetap.

Di relief kita hanya melihat sebelas apsara, walau mungkin dengan mudah bisa memuat enam belas jika perupa mau. Ini mungkin mewakili ragam lainnya, atau mungkin hanya kemauan para perancang. Empat terlihat berdiri dan tujuh duduk. Lagi-lagi adegan bertempat di perdesaan, bukan di kota.

en: After some time Maitrakanyaka, driven by his curiosity and desire, set off again for the south and came to Brahmottara where he was greeted by thirty-two divine nymphs.

It may have been the difficulty of fitting such a large number on the panel that drove the sculptors to start curtailing their number on the last reliefs. Here, anyway, we see only fourteen. One stands besides Maitrakanyaka and the others sit and stand on the left of the relief.
id: Setelah beberapa waktu, Maitrakanyaka, didorong oleh rasa ingin tahu dan hasrat, berangkat lagi ke selatan dan tiba di Brahmottara, tempat ia disambut oleh tiga puluh dua bidadari surga.

Mungkin sulit untuk menempatkan sejumlah besar bidadari dalam panel, yang mendorong para perupa untuk mulai membatasi jumlah mereka di relief terakhir. Di sini, bagaimanapun, kita hanya melihat empat belas. Satu berdiri di samping Maitrakanyaka dan yang lainnya duduk dan berdiri di kiri relief.

en: Traveling again south Maitrakanyaka came to the city made of iron, and as he entered the door shut behind him. He saw a tall man with a fiery wheel which was cutting his head open. Learning the punishment was because of ill-treating his mother, Maitrakanyaka remembered his own wicked deed, and the wheel then descended onto his head. After vowing that he would wear the wheel, and no one else should ever suffer like he was suffering, he was reborn in Tuṣita Heaven because of his compassion.

There are two scenes in this panel: on the far right we see the tall man with the wheel cutting his head. Maitrakanyaka stands in front and is in conversation with a rakṣasa who reveals the reason for the man’s suffering. A small building stands in the middle and divides the scene. On the left Maitrakanyaka has already been reborn in Tuṣita Heaven and is enjoying the fruits of his compassion.
id: Bepergian lagi ke selatan, Maitrakanyaka tiba di kota yang terbuat dari besi, dan saat ia masuk, pintu di belakangnya menutup. Ia melihat lelaki jangkung dengan roda api yang membelah kepalanya. Mengetahui hukumannya dikarenakan memperlakukan ibunya dengan buruk, Maitrakanyaka teringat perbuatan jahatnya sendiri, dan roda meluncur ke kepalanya. Setelah bersumpah bahwa ia akan menanggung roda itu, sehingga tidak ada orang lain yang akan menderita seperti dirinya, Maitrakanyaka terlahir ulang di Surga Tuṣita karena welas asihnya.

Ada dua adegan di panel ini: di kanan jauh kita lihat lelaki jangkung dengan roda membelah kepalanya. Maitrakanyaka berdiri di depannya dan bercakap dengan raksasa yang menyingkap sebab penderitaan lelaki itu. Bangunan kecil berdiri di tengah dan menyekat adegan. Di kiri, Maitrakanyaka telah terlahir ulang di Surga Tuṣita dan menikmati buah dari welas asihnya.

en: In the centre a Bodhisattva, marked by the halo, is sitting in meditation on a raised seat. He is holding a lotus in his left hand and holding his hand in a mudrā. His sitting cloth drapes down from the seat on both sides in front of him, and underneath a lion is seen looking out at the viewer.

On the right are lined up ten females, three of which are sitting. Some of them hold offerings of various sorts. On the left seven men sit on the floor holding up the regalia, and between them and the Bodhisattva is a female attendant holding a fly-whisk.
id: Di tengah, Bodhisattwa, ditandai oleh aura kepala, duduk bermeditasi di kursi tinggi. Ia memegang teratai di tangan kirinya dan tangannya membentuk mudrā. Kain alas duduk menggantung dari kursi di kedua sisi di depannya, dan di bawah singa terlihat menatap ke arah penglihat.

Di kanan, berbaris sepuluh perempuan, tiga di antaranya duduk. Beberapa dari mereka memegang berbagai macam persembahan. Di kiri tujuh lelaki duduk di lantai memegangi tanda kebesaran, dan di antara mereka dan Bodhisattwa ada pelayan perempuan memegang kebutan.

en: On the far left we see a wilderness scene with trees, birds and various animals. This is the destination of the entourage who travel from right to left across the panel. On the far right is a fruiting tree, very nicely drawn.
The main part of the panel is taken up with what must be a king sitting on horseback, and his nobles who are going out to hunt. Most hold bows and arrows, or other weapons.
id: Di kiri jauh, kita lihat adegan belantara dengan pepohonan, burung, dan berbagai binatang. Ini adalah tujuan rombongan yang bepergian dari kanan ke kiri melintasi panel. Di kanan jauh ada pohon berbuah, dipahat sangat bagus.
Bagian utama panel diisi dengan yang pastinya raja yang duduk di atas kuda, dan para bangsawannya yang pergi berburu. Sebagian besar memegang busur dan panah, atau senjata lainnya.

en: The main character in the scene, who is seated towards the right, is marked as a Bodhisattva by the still visible halo, but the figure is badly worn down and broken in places. We can see that he had one foot on the floor and the other looks like it was in a knee sling.

On the far right are some female attendants sitting and standing near a tree. On the left of the Bodhisattva stand two females, and another character who was sitting and is also worn away. On the left of the panel is the usual entourage and signs of royalty, including soldiers, an elephant, a horse and the regalia.
id: Sosok utama dalam adegan, yang duduk di kanan, ditandai sebagai Bodhisattwa dengan aura kepala yang masih dapat dilihat, tetapi sosok itu rusak parah dan pecah di beberapa bagian. Kita bisa melihat bahwa ia punya satu kaki di lantai dan yang lain terlihat seperti berbebat lutut.

Di kanan jauh ada beberapa pelayan perempuan duduk dan berdiri di dekat pohon. Di kiri Bodhisattwa, berdiri dua perempuan, dan sosok lain yang sedang duduk juga rusak. Di kiri panel ada rombongan dan lambang kerajaan seperti biasa, termasuk prajurit, gajah, kuda, dan tanda kebesaran.

en: There are no signs of a halo behind any of the main characters, so we must take it this is a secular scene. On the right, and under six trees, sit six kings, if their jewellery and coiffure are anything to go by. Three of the figures are quite worn down and featureless now.

On the left is the main figure: a king sits at ease on a raised seat, and under a simple pavilion. He is surrounded by female attendants. On the floor in the middle sits a bearded man, presumably an emissary from the six kings, who is presenting something to the person who sits between him and the king.
id: Tidak ada tanda aura kepala di belakang sosok utama mana pun, jadi kita harus menganggap ini sebagai adegan duniawi. Di kanan, dan di bawah enam pohon, duduk enam raja, jika perhiasan dan gaya rambut mereka dijadikan acuan. Tiga dari sosok, sekarang sudah cukup rusak dan rata.

Di kiri ada sosok utama: raja duduk santai di kursi tinggi, dan di bawah anjungan sederhana. Ia dikelilingi oleh pelayan perempuan. Di lantai, di tengah, duduk lelaki berjanggut, kemungkinan utusan dari enam raja, yang sedang mempersembahkan sesuatu kepada orang yang duduk di antara ia dan raja.

en: What appears to be the same six kings are seen here again, but this time on the left of the scene, and standing, not sitting. It may also be that the character on his knee in front of them is the same as the one giving the gift in the previous scene.

If we surmise correctly then the character under the parasol will be the main king, who is now standing. The characters on the right behind him are quite possibly his female attendants, but they are so worn out it is hard to tell.
id: Apa yang tampak seperti enam raja yang sama terlihat lagi di sini, tetapi kali ini di kiri adegan, dan berdiri, tidak duduk. Mungkin juga karena sosok yang berlutut di depan mereka sama dengan sosok yang memberi persembahan di adegan sebelumnya.

Jika kita menduga dengan benar, maka sosok di bawah payung adalah raja utama, yang kini berdiri. Sosok di kanan di belakangnya sangat mungkin pelayan perempuannya, tetapi mereka begitu rusak sehingga sulit untuk mengatakannya.

en: This time the main character, who sits on the left atop a raised seat is marked by a halo, so that he is probably another Bodhisattva king. His female attendants accompany him. He has his hand raised in the fearless mudrā.
In a simple, but decorated, pavilion on the right of the panel we see now seven kings, a few of whom hold their hands in añjali. Again a number of them are badly worn down.
id: Kali ini sosok utama, yang duduk di kiri di atas kursi tinggi ditandai dengan aura kepala, sehingga ia mungkin raja Bodhisattwa lainnya. Para pelayan perempuan menemaninya. Ia mengangkat tangannya dalam mudrā tak gentar.
Dalam anjungan yang sederhana, namun dihias, di kanan panel, kita sekarang melihat tujuh raja, beberapa di antaranya menangkupkan tangan. Lagi-lagi beberapa dari mereka sangat rusak.

en: In one of the most dynamic of the sculptures at Borobudur we see a king, or at least a member of the nobility, drawing his bow back. The whole stance is very dramatic, even though the arrow is no longer seen.

On the right, under a fruit tree, sit four figures, one of whom holds a quiver and one of whom salutes the main character. On the left sit eight members of the nobility, who hold various postures, and similarly sit under fruiting trees.
id: Dalam salah satu pahatan paling dinamis di Borobudur, kita melihat raja, atau setidaknya anggota kaum bangsawan, menarik busurnya ke belakang. Keseluruhan tatanannya sangat dramatis, walau panah tak terlihat lagi.

Di kanan, di bawah pohon buah, duduk empat sosok, satu darinya memegang kantong panah, dan satu darinya memberi hormat kepada sosok utama. Di kiri, duduk delapan anggota bangsawan, dengan berbagai postur, dan samasama duduk di bawah pohon berbuah.

en: A very typical round-shaped stūpa stands at the centre of this scene, it is decorated around the middle, and is under a simple pavilion. The umbrella above the stūpa is clearly drawn, as is the double lotus, which it sits on. Inside the pavilion stand the king and the queen, and flowers fall from the heavens.

On the right are the male characters, some kneeling, some standing, who have various offerings. Amongst the ladies-in-waiting on the left some hold offerings, while others hold their hands up in worship. On this worshipful note we end the reliefs on this wall.
id: Stupa berbentuk bulat yang sangat khas berdiri di tengah adegan ini, sekitar tengahnya dihias, dan berada di bawah anjungan sederhana. Payung di atas stupa dipahat jelas, juga teratai ganda, yang tertancap di atasnya. Dalam anjungan berdiri raja dan ratu, dan bebungaan jatuh dari langit.

Di kanan ada sosok-sosok lelaki, sebagian berlutut, sebagian berdiri, yang memegang berbagai persembahan. Di antara dayang di kiri, sebagian memegang persembahan, sementara yang lain mengangkat tangan mereka memuja. Dengan catatan pemujaan ini, kita akhiri rangkaian relief di dinding ini.
